AF.content: is circumcision an exterior mark? is it an archive?
AF.linkedContent: is circumcision an exterior mark? is it an archive?

AF.content: circumcision carries literal singularity into figurality
a document of an archive, leaves trace of incision right on skin [superficial, like literature] lips of a wound, pellicular superimposition [invagination & circumcision?]
AF.linkedContent: a document of an archive, leaves trace of incision right on skin [superficial, like literature] lips of a wound, pellicular superimposition [invagination & circumcision?]

AF.content: bind anew: an act of love (paternal) (sous peau neuve)
AF.linkedContent: bind anew: an act of love (paternal) (sous peau neuve)

AF.content: lawmakers w/out which one can’t have archives, conservation (memory) puts into reserve (“store”), accumulates, capitalizes, stocks a quasi-infinity of layers (hypermnesic, hypomnesic epidermises of books & penises)
AF.linkedContent: lawmakers w/out which one can’t have archives, conservation (memory) puts into reserve (“store”), accumulates, capitalizes, stocks a quasi-infinity of layers (hypermnesic, hypomnesic epidermises of books & penises)

AF.content: [iterability of circumcision] at once inaugural & recurrent
AF.linkedContent: [iterability of circumcision] at once inaugural & recurrent

AF.content: scholar repeats the father’s circumcision [Yerushalmi calling Freud back to his father’s faith], even if only by figure
AF.linkedContent: scholar repeats the father’s circumcision [Yerushalmi calling Freud back to his father’s faith], even if only by figure

AF.content: “I shall say we” to a ghost or newborn > indestructible covenant, extraordinary performative (like a circumcision)
AF.linkedContent: “I shall say we” to a ghost or newborn > indestructible covenant, extraordinary performative (like a circumcision)

AF.content: [re: 2 def. of circumcision] 1) symbolic substitute of castration of the son by primitive father (structural) 2) “conducting fossil” for investigating memory of heritage (historical)
AF.linkedContent: [re: 2 def. of circumcision] 1) symbolic substitute of castration of the son by primitive father (structural) 2) “conducting fossil” for investigating memory of heritage (historical)

AF.content: [re: Freud/psychoanalysis] can a science depend on something like a circumcision?
AF.linkedContent: [re: Freud/psychoanalysis] can a science depend on something like a circumcision?

SH.content: circumcision only once, at the same time “first & last,” ring, seal of alliance, anniversary of archeology/eschatology > ring traces, carves the “unwiederholbar (unrepeatable)”
SH.linkedContent: circumcision only once, at the same time “first & last,” ring, seal of alliance, anniversary of archeology/eschatology > ring traces, carves the “unwiederholbar (unrepeatable)”

SH.content: “one time” in English, but “one turn,” “una vez,” “una volta,” in vicissitudes of latinity
SH.linkedContent: “one time” in English, but “one turn,” “una vez,” “una volta,” in vicissitudes of latinity

SH.content: conventional forms of dating (charts, coded signs, spatiotemporal plottings, clocks,  calendar) assign, consign, absolute singularity, must mark themselves off from themselves, a fatally equivocal power that enunciates the possibility of recurrence > not absolute recurrence (i.e. of the one time of circumcision/birth) but spectral recurrence of that which never will return
SH.linkedContent: conventional forms of dating (charts, coded signs, spatiotemporal plottings, clocks, calendar) assign, consign, absolute singularity, must mark themselves off from themselves, a fatally equivocal power that enunciates the possibility of recurrence > not absolute recurrence (i.e. of the one time of circumcision/birth) but spectral recurrence of that which never will return

SH.content: Sichelschrift > cuts in coming around > another turning (not rounding), another trope, inscribes letters in cutting all around > circumcises words in silence
SH.linkedContent: Sichelschrift > cuts in coming around > another turning (not rounding), another trope, inscribes letters in cutting all around > circumcises words in silence

SH.content: “Sie setzt / Wundgelesens über (it carries across / the wound-read)”: [circumcision in the reading] “reader-gatherer” > wound offers itself to be read—not readable, but a part of reading
SH.linkedContent: “Sie setzt / Wundgelesens über (it carries across / the wound-read)”: [circumcision in the reading] “reader-gatherer” > wound offers itself to be read—not readable, but a part of reading

SH.content: circumcision recalls the body, by wounding it, to its condition as word, carnal mark >
SH.linkedContent: circumcision recalls the body, by wounding it, to its condition as word, carnal mark >

SH.content: can one ever circumcise a name w/out doing something to the body?
SH.linkedContent: can one ever circumcise a name w/out doing something to the body?

SH.content: tropic of circumcision: cuts, caesuras, ciphered alliances, wounded rings
SH.linkedContent: tropic of circumcision: cuts, caesuras, ciphered alliances, wounded rings

SH.content: wound, very experience of reading, universal
SH.linkedContent: wound, very experience of reading, universal

SH.content: circumcising the heart even before St. Paul
SH.linkedContent: circumcising the heart even before St. Paul

SH.content: anyone who experiences circumcision (body cut, shibboleth, blessing, purification) is a Jew
SH.linkedContent: anyone who experiences circumcision (body cut, shibboleth, blessing, purification) is a Jew

SH.linkedContent: displace literality of belonging if, w/ Judaism, nothing properly belongs, anyone or no one may be a Jew, Jew: no one’s name, the only one, no one's circumcision

SH.linkedContent: command (appeal, desire, supplication, prayer) [re: imperative beschneide das Wort]

SH.content: the proper of the body, a place of circumcision
SH.linkedContent: the proper of the body, a place of circumcision

SH.content: circumcision of the word: an event of the body (from shibboleth to sibboleth)
SH.linkedContent: circumcision of the word: an event of the body (from shibboleth to sibboleth)

SH.content: the one who awaits his name, awaits its bestowal by circumcision, draws whole poem toward him in absolute dissymmetry
SH.linkedContent: the one who awaits his name, awaits its bestowal by circumcision, draws whole poem toward him in absolute dissymmetry

SH.content: circumcision: decision of the word—inscribed in the body—just in the heart (precisely)
SH.linkedContent: circumcision: decision of the word—inscribed in the body—just in the heart (precisely)

SH.content: circumcision inscribes Nothing in the heart (flesh, living word), to the point of bleeding
SH.linkedContent: circumcision inscribes Nothing in the heart (flesh, living word), to the point of bleeding

SH.content: circumcision is a determination, defines & decides, but to ask for circumcision is not to ask for meaning or object > circumcision always binds body to language
SH.linkedContent: circumcision is a determination, defines & decides, but to ask for circumcision is not to ask for meaning or object > circumcision always binds body to language

SH.content: because one can make use of shibboleth, it can be turned against oneself, the circumcised are proscribed, held at border, excluded, reduced to ashes, in the mere name
SH.linkedContent: because one can make use of shibboleth, it can be turned against oneself, the circumcised are proscribed, held at border, excluded, reduced to ashes, in the mere name

SH.content: how to guard against double edge of shibboleth? w/ “living Nothing in the heart,” perhaps
SH.linkedContent: how to guard against double edge of shibboleth? w/ “living Nothing in the heart,” perhaps

SH.content: circumcision of word is not dated in history, has no age, but calls forth date, opens word to other, of all that calls itself (the name, blessing of name, yes & no) > it sets turning the ring
SH.linkedContent: circumcision of word is not dated in history, has no age, but calls forth date, opens word to other, of all that calls itself (the name, blessing of name, yes & no) > it sets turning the ring

FWT.content: heritage of circumcision precedes speech, oath, contract
FWT.linkedContent: heritage of circumcision precedes speech, oath, contract

FWT.content: there is a universal “structure” of heteronomic election: I am the only one called to do this or that, irreplaceable in the place of decision, in obligation to respond “I am here,” this election of each gives to all responsibility worthy of the name, if there is any, its chance/condition > also, Derrida is very suspicious of “doctrine” of election, & binding this universal to Judaism
FWT.linkedContent: there is a universal “structure” of heteronomic election: I am the only one called to do this or that, irreplaceable in the place of decision, in obligation to respond “I am here,” this election of each gives to all responsibility worthy of the name, if there is any, its chance/condition > also, Derrida is very suspicious of “doctrine” of election, & binding this universal to Judaism

FWT.content: circumcision: someone marked my destiny before I had a word to say > (true for women too, something preceded your Catholicism, Derrida tells E.R.)
FWT.linkedContent: circumcision: someone marked my destiny before I had a word to say > (true for women too, something preceded your Catholicism, Derrida tells E.R.)

SP.content: the double role of woman as truth’s recession, and as the nonbeliever in truth, she is like the Jew in her “delight in dissimulation,” affirmative power
SP.linkedContent: the double role of woman as truth’s recession, and as the nonbeliever in truth, she is like the Jew in her “delight in dissimulation,” affirmative power

SP.content: does Nietzsche refer to Jew because of the way circumcision marks simulation & castration?
SP.linkedContent: does Nietzsche refer to Jew because of the way circumcision marks simulation & castration?

SW.content: tallith recalls me to the “only once” of mortal wound [circumcision?] (it could speak but it never does, we both know that)
SW.linkedContent: tallith recalls me to the “only once” of mortal wound [circumcision?] (it could speak but it never does, we both know that)

SW.content: unlike the veil, the tallith depends on One of the unique, singular event whose repetition repeats only, and that’s history, the “only once” of the Law given
SW.linkedContent: unlike the veil, the tallith depends on One of the unique, singular event whose repetition repeats only, and that’s history, the “only once” of the Law given

SW.content: tallith hangs on body like a memory of circumcision
SW.linkedContent: tallith hangs on body like a memory of circumcision

SW.content: St. Paul thought he knew the literality of the letter, thought he was distinguishing for the first time, & he prided himself on it, wrongly, the circumcision of the heart (breath, spirit) from that of the flesh (body, “acc. the letter”)
SW.linkedContent: St. Paul thought he knew the literality of the letter, thought he was distinguishing for the first time, & he prided himself on it, wrongly, the circumcision of the heart (breath, spirit) from that of the flesh (body, “acc. the letter”)

SW.content: “not in a hurry”: I am against those who prescribe the veil, against those who forbid it (same w/ circumcision) > people don’t realize any longer that the scholarly, secular, democratic belong to cultures of tallith & veil: contamination is everywhere
SW.linkedContent: “not in a hurry”: I am against those who prescribe the veil, against those who forbid it (same w/ circumcision) > people don’t realize any longer that the scholarly, secular, democratic belong to cultures of tallith & veil: contamination is everywhere

SW.content: tallith is proper to man (not woman), like circumcision

HLP.content: St. Paul: “I have been all things to all men…” “…everything in order to win them all over” > “Did Paul lie?” on the subject of circumcision
HLP.linkedContent: St. Paul: “I have been all things to all men…” “…everything in order to win them all over” > “Did Paul lie?” on the subject of circumcision

CIR.content: circumfession never circumpletes itself, unsealing abandoning the circle open, as long as blood continues its venue in my veins > vein can’t be closed by textual machine or program
CIR.linkedContent: circumfession never circumpletes itself, unsealing abandoning the circle open, as long as blood continues its venue in my veins > vein can’t be closed by textual machine or program

CIR.content: unforgettable circumcision has carried me to the place I had to go
CIR.linkedContent: unforgettable circumcision has carried me to the place I had to go

CIR.content: [on Bennington’s lack of quotations]: if sentences are proper names, G. is circumcising me, doing w/out my body, producing “logic” or “grammar”
CIR.linkedContent: [on Bennington’s lack of quotations]: if sentences are proper names, G. is circumcising me, doing w/out my body, producing “logic” or “grammar”

CIR.content: Derrida’s “sublime” encyclopedia on circumcision, which he’ll never do anything w/
CIR.linkedContent: Derrida’s “sublime” encyclopedia on circumcision, which he’ll never do anything w/

CIR.content: the cruelty of circumcision, the mother’s cruelty: she had to eat the still bloody foreskin [sublime gate of fellatio, mohels]
CIR.linkedContent: the cruelty of circumcision, the mother’s cruelty: she had to eat the still bloody foreskin [sublime gate of fellatio, mohels]

CIR.content: avowal is always a denouncing of self (still weaving cloth of affabulation dating from SP)
CIR.linkedContent: avowal is always a denouncing of self (still weaving cloth of affabulation dating from SP)

CIR.content: circumcision: all I ever wrote about
CIR.linkedContent: circumcision: all I ever wrote about

CIR.content: desire for literature is circumcision, text read does not suffice, has to be eaten, sucked
CIR.linkedContent: desire for literature is circumcision, text read does not suffice, has to be eaten, sucked

CIR.content: “I shall wonder what, from my birth or thereabouts, to turn around has meant”
CIR.linkedContent: “I shall wonder what, from my birth or thereabouts, to turn around has meant”

CIR.content: I love words too much because I have no language of my own, only false escarres, blackish, purulent crusts which form around my mother’s body, escharosis, English scar, cut, eschatology of my circumcision
CIR.linkedContent: I love words too much because I have no language of my own, only false escarres, blackish, purulent crusts which form around my mother’s body, escharosis, English scar, cut, eschatology of my circumcision

CIR.linkedContent: man who accuses himself so much of lying must be madly in love w/ truth, to the point of weeping for it

CIR.content: those who are queuing up [for circumcision], too late, authorizing themselves to speak for the “Jews,” don’t know what truth they’re talking about
CIR.linkedContent: those who are queuing up [for circumcision], too late, authorizing themselves to speak for the “Jews,” don’t know what truth they’re talking about

CIR.content: only philosopher to describe his penis
CIR.linkedContent: only philosopher to describe his penis

CIR.content: circumcision, 1st event to write itself on my body, exemplary counterscar we have to read w/out seeing > outside of language, time of a proper name, the rest is literature
CIR.linkedContent: circumcision, 1st event to write itself on my body, exemplary counterscar we have to read w/out seeing > outside of language, time of a proper name, the rest is literature

CIR.content: foreskin & truth (detour/delay): question of knowing by whom by what the violence of circumcision was imposed
CIR.linkedContent: foreskin & truth (detour/delay): question of knowing by whom by what the violence of circumcision was imposed

CIR.content: my absolute knowledge: writing promised unto death, writing that must come to an end > any reader (addressee) becoming the uncircumcised [son] to be confessed—line thrown to girl-martyrs [wondering why they’re reading Derrida]
CIR.linkedContent: my absolute knowledge: writing promised unto death, writing that must come to an end > any reader (addressee) becoming the uncircumcised [son] to be confessed—line thrown to girl-martyrs [wondering why they’re reading Derrida]

CIR.linkedContent: operation of circumcision retains essential relation to production of screen

CIR.content: [re: SA] fault of mother, remain as mythical as my circumcision
CIR.linkedContent: [re: SA] fault of mother, remain as mythical as my circumcision

CIR.content: blood mixed w/ saliva, w/ sperm, fellatio, make all the readers drool; p. 158 autofellocircumcision; p. 218 ejaculating into bloody mouth of circumcising mother > exultant alliance, her legs open, breasts btwn my legs, both laughing, passing skin from mouth to mouth like a ring
CIR.linkedContent: blood mixed w/ saliva, w/ sperm, fellatio, make all the readers drool; p. 158 autofellocircumcision; p. 218 ejaculating into bloody mouth of circumcising mother > exultant alliance, her legs open, breasts btwn my legs, both laughing, passing skin from mouth to mouth like a ring

CIR.content: the circumcised is the proper
CIR.linkedContent: the circumcised is the proper

CIR.content: if you knew, G., my experience of prayers, you would know everything, my “without-interest” in the depths of me, “I” is only misdirection—presumed crime I’m calling circumcision
CIR.linkedContent: if you knew, G., my experience of prayers, you would know everything, my “without-interest” in the depths of me, “I” is only misdirection—presumed crime I’m calling circumcision

CIR.content: G.’s countersigning attestation, daring to kill the quotation marks, w/out quoting me, calling me back to a moment when I didn’t yet know what circumcision means [?]
CIR.linkedContent: G.’s countersigning attestation, daring to kill the quotation marks, w/out quoting me, calling me back to a moment when I didn’t yet know what circumcision means [?]

CIR.linkedContent: intolerable foreclosure when I write: the already known, loved, that can’t be quoted; gather myself in circle of cum, circus of circum, before the constituting witness I’m always fleeing

CIR.content: circumcision (what covers the real, all that is left of a language, culture), threat that makes me write, losing life at this moment, my life is that other that ‘I lose’
CIR.linkedContent: circumcision (what covers the real, all that is left of a language, culture), threat that makes me write, losing life at this moment, my life is that other that ‘I lose’

CIR.content: ci, scie, ciseaux, si, ceci (enormous narcissistic monument), on the ci of circumcision is gathered the interrupted autobiothanatoheterographical opus; never known how to love save in the place of a figure unknown to me
CIR.linkedContent: ci, scie, ciseaux, si, ceci (enormous narcissistic monument), on the ci of circumcision is gathered the interrupted autobiothanatoheterographical opus; never known how to love save in the place of a figure unknown to me

CIR.content: invent circumcision, like I am doing here, refounding all religions, playfully
CIR.linkedContent: invent circumcision, like I am doing here, refounding all religions, playfully

CIR.content: my uncircumcised sons, only people whose judgment I fear
CIR.linkedContent: my uncircumcised sons, only people whose judgment I fear

CIR.linkedContent: am someOne who the One God never stops de-circumcising, hounds [s’acharner?] herself to make bleed in dispersion: salus in sanguine

CIR.content: itching the effect of circumcision to share it w/ others
CIR.linkedContent: itching the effect of circumcision to share it w/ others

CIR.content: I am erect in my circumcision for centuries (petrified memory, ammonite [fossil index])

CIR.content: sign of circumcision will ensure Jewish nation an eternal existence > this sign of circumcision & election is foreign to understanding and true virtue

CIR.linkedContent: in search of Saint Foreskin, gram of “lost part of self,” has the form of a Ring [objet a?]

CIR.linkedContent: day of circumcision: a de-cision was taken in me w/out me > Jealousy & virginity, my two nipples

CIR.content: before speech, among Jews alone, there’s circumcision
